metadata.title: CVE-2022-4883 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libXpm. When processing files with .Z or .gzextensions, the library calls external programs to compress and uncompressfiles, relying on the PATH environment variable to find these programs,which could allow a malicious user to execute other programs bymanipulating the PATH environment variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
xpmutils - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxpm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
motif package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
